H0.text: Sebaceous gland is an oil gland associated with hair follicles, found all over the body, that helps lubricate and waterproof the skin and hair.

H1.text: Sweat gland is an oil gland associated with hair follicles that is found all over the body and helps lubricate and waterproof the skin and hair.

H2.text: Melanin gland is an oil gland associated with hair follicles, found all over the body, and helps to lubricate and waterproof the skin and hair.

H3.text: Gametes gland is associated with hair follicles, is found all over the body, and helps to lubricate and waterproof the skin and hair.

A4.text: Sebaceous glands are microscopic exocrine glands in the skin that open into hair follicles to secrete sebum, which lubricates the hair and skin of mammals.

A5.text: Sebaceous glands secrete acids that form the acid mantle, a thin, slightly acidic film on the skin that acts as a barrier to microbes.
